description:
About the job
About Veeco

You probably don’t realize it, but what we do at Veeco touches the lives of every person, every day. It’s a bold statement, but it’s true. From the smartphones in our pockets that access the world’s collective knowledge, to the cloud-based services where all that information lives, to high-speed wireless communication and computing power needed to drive artificial intelligence, augmented and virtual reality, gaming and so much more, our technology is all around us.

We design, develop, manufacture, and service highly complex, cutting-edge machines used by our customers to create the essential devices that drive the digital age, connect the world, and improve the human experience. Along with the world’s leading technology companies, many of which are household names, we help solve their most difficult material science challenges, enabling technologies for a more connected, sustainable, and convenient world.

We’re looking for material difference-makers to join our growing team. Interested? Learn more at www.veeco.com/careers .

Overview

Veeco has an opening in Plainview, NY, for a Mechanical Engineer to participate in the delivery of New Product Development (NPD), Engineered-to-Order (ETO), and Continuous Improvement (CIP) work for compound semiconductor capital equipment. The Mechanical Design Engineer will be working on complex wafer processing equipment involving ion beam etch, ion beam deposition, chemical and physical vapor deposition technologies. This role involves overall system design, vacuum vessel design, ion beam source design, incorporation of (Original Equipment Manufacturer) OEM components, as well as many other engineering and design areas.

Responsibilities

 Work on development projects of vacuum process equipment, with the responsibility for all mechanical design aspects and manufacturing of the equipment, subassemblies and components 
 Provide mechanical engineering expertise, while focusing on design quality, reliability, cost, and ease of manufacturing 
 Perform analytical studies and theoretical calculations, requiring a variety of engineering knowledge, including analysis of vacuum vessels, heat transfer, material structural analysis, fluids, motion mechanisms 
 Define mechanical design specifications based on customer requirements and company capabilities 
 Prepare presentations and present design concepts, ideas, and test results to internal and external customers 
 Provide expertise in mechanical engineering while participating in design reviews; support procurement efforts in correlation with overall project deadlines 
 Provide hands-on assistance and support to the manufacturing team 
 Develop test plans and design of experiments and is directly involved in prototype development and testing 
 Create and release engineering documentation through the ECO process 

Qualifications

BS Degree in Mechanical Engineering is required. Experience with SolidWorks, Inventor, ProE or similar 3D CAD system is also required. Experience designing subassemblies and components is a plus.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

 Experience designing Capital Equipment for Semiconductor Industry is preferred (vacuum vessels, wafer fixtures, motion mechanisms, etc). 
 Knowledge of Ion beam and/or Vacuum physics is preferred 
 Finite element analysis experience in structural and/or thermal is preferred 
 Experience with SAP, or similar PLM system, is preferred 
 Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment as part of a multi-disciplinary team and able to take initiative 
 Excellent oral and written communication skills, including ability to make technical presentations and interface with all levels of management, suppliers, and customers 
 Must be hands-on with devices, prototyping, and troubleshooting 
 Knowledge of SEMI regulatory standards is a plus 
 Project management experience is a plus 
 Ability to travel up to 25% of the time to customer sites and/or supplier facilities on an as-needed basis 

The expected salary range for this position is $63,180-$80,028, plus bonus opportunity. When determining your pay, we will consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors. If your salary requirements exceed the advertised range and you remain interested in Veeco, we encourage you to apply or email your resume to recruiting@veeco.com .

Other Benefits Include

 Medical, Dental, and Vision 
 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) 
 401(k) with Company Match 
 Holiday, Vacation, and Sick Time 
 Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) 
 Commuter Benefits 
 Life and Accident Insurance 
 Disability Insurance 
 Tuition Reimbursement 
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
 Identity Theft Remediation 
 Emergency Travel Assistance 

Veeco is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

About the job
We are looking for a physics expert to join our team to train AI models. You will measure the progress of these AI chatbots, evaluate their logic, and solve problems to improve the quality of each model.

In this role you will need to hold an expert understanding of physics- a completed or in progress Masters/PhD is preferred but not required. Other related fields include, but are not limited to: Astrophysics, Biophysics, Electrical Engineering, Nuclear Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mathematics.

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly starting at $40+ per hour, with bonuses on high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:
Give AI chatbots diverse and complex physics problems and evaluate their outputs
Evaluate the quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:
Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Detail-oriented
Proficient in mathematics, inductive/deductive reasoning, physical/temporal/ spatial reasoning
A current, in progress, or completed Masters and/or PhD is preferred but not required

Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
About the job
About Burns
Burns is a nationally respected provider of specialized engineering services, bringing highly-technical, sought-after engineering expertise to complex transportation and critical infrastructure projects.

Facilities & Infrastructure Team
For more than 50 years, we have built our reputation on outstanding client service. Ranked a Top Workplace and ENR Top 500 Design Firm, we are personally invested in helping our clients achieve their goals, sharing in their passions, and successfully guiding them through the challenges of complex projects using our no surprises Burns Unique Client Experience.

We are currently seeking a Mechanical Engineer to join our strategic office in New York City. 

Position Summary:
Performs the technical activities on assigned projects and understands and adheres to the discipline technical policies and procedures. Participates in the production of technical studies, investigations and designs in support of assigned projects. Seeks guidance from the Senior Engineers, Principal Engineers and Chief Engineers to develop complex engineering solutions and makes independent decisions to develop solutions of low to moderate complexity. Provides technical production direction to Designers and CAD Operators. Provides production of projects on-time, in budget and of highest technical quality.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
Ensures that company technical policies and procedures are practiced during the execution of projects for clients.
Assists in developing design approaches and concepts on assigned projects and requests assistance from the senior technical staff when needed.
Provides discipline specific engineering for systems and designs of low to moderate complexity.
Delegation of work tasks and collaboration with subordinate staff, monitor and review delegated work for accuracy
Assists in the execution of technical training programs for design staff.
As requested, assists in the development of proposals and presentations to clients.
Assists in the performance management process by providing feedback to the Project Manager for performance evaluations
Assists Project Managers in the coordination of project designs with other disciplines including attendance at project meetings.
Performs specific engineering studies and design analyses and assists the Project Manager in establishing budgets, cost estimates and project schedules.
Reviews shop drawings, record changes and communicates directly with suppliers, contractors and client representatives as required
Performs on-site inspections during construction and coordinates design requirements with contractors and equipment suppliers
Uses design software and equipment to prepare engineering and design documents.
Actively participates in professional organizations and/or client groups where the technical reputation and image of the firm may be enhanced.
Performs assigned work in time frame and budget allotted. 

Key Requirements/Qualifications:
A minimum of 5-10 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
PE license is strongly preferred.
Healthcare project experience is preferred but not required. 

Why Join The Burns Team
Recently voted a Top Workplace by philly.com, we credit our strength as an organization to our talented, driven, vibrant team. Burns is an ENR Top 500 Firm and has been named a MEP Giant by Consulting-Specifying Engineer Magazine, as well as a Hot Firm by Zweig. We are industry experts, proven leaders, innovative thinkers, and team players. We put our clients’ successes and best interests first, because their success is our success. We have fun at work because we love making a difference in the world. We are looking for high-energy, bright, collaborative individuals who want the opportunity to “write their own story” with us.

Applying To Burns
As a member of our team, you will enjoy a competitive compensation and benefits package. Interested, qualified candidates must apply on the Burns’ career site at www.burns-group.com to be considered for a specific opportunity. Individuals needing assistance to apply for an open opportunity should contact the Human Resources Department at hrdepartment@burns-group.com.

 At Burns Engineering, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Burns believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success

title: Engineer, Mechanical Systems
description:
About the job
About Otto Aviation

OTTO is developing the world’s first fifth-generation business jet, designed for sustainability through the innovative use of advanced super-laminar aerodynamics and high-precision, net-shaped composites. Flight tests of our technology demonstrator validate a dramatic reduction in fuel burn and allow a sizeable improvement in cabin comfort. Otto Aviation is designing world-class aircraft from first principles physics and delivering ground-breaking aircraft and economic performance.

About The Role

Otto Aviation is seeking a dynamic engineer to support the design, development, and integration of mechanical systems. You will join a team developing the world’s most efficient aircraft. Otto Aviation is seeking first principles engineers that balance creativity with experience while working within an effective team atmosphere.

What You’ll Do 

Work with Principal and Senior engineers to support the design and development of mechanical aerospace systems, ensuring compliance with technical specifications, performance standards, and regulatory requirements, to include the following:
Flight Controls (ATA 27)
Landing Gear (ATA 32)
Ice Protection (ATA 30)
Perform trade studies across key mechanical systems and features against requirements.
Support supplier selection and integration activities.
Mechanical system development through conceptual design, preliminary design, detailed design, integration, and qualification phases.
Coordinate with cross functional teams to define and validate mechanical system interfaces with adjacent systems and structures.
Generate engineering analysis, drawings, schematics, specifications, test plans & reports, and compliance documentation.
Support requirements definition for system integrated test lab 
Support the development of CAD definition of mechanical systems within Otto’s PLM system.
Collaborate with maintenance and operations experts to meet reliability and maintainability targets.
Support component, system, and aircraft-level functional testing, including ground and flight test.
Who You Are

Education

B. S. in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering, or equivalent.

Experience

2-5 years of experience in the design and development of mechanical systems for the aviation industry.
Knowledge of mechanical systems common in modern Part 23 / Part 25 business aircraft.
Experience with FAR Part 23 and/or Part 25 certification requirements and processes pertinent to mechanical systems.
Experience with RTCA D-160G and SAE ARP4754A, desired
Experience with ASME Y14.100 Drawings and Y14.5 GD&T
Proficiency with Dassault 3DX and/or CATIA V6 to generate and interrogate both 3D and 2D data. 
Knowledge of industry standards and hands-on experience.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to closely coordinate with manufacturing to support MRB activities.

Required Skills (Interpersonal)

Active Listening: Practice to gain insight and truly understand all project stakeholders.
Critical Thinking: Make prompt, informed and value-based decisions for the project.
Organization: Focus on agenda, schedules, frameworks, and methodologies, as well as communicating tasks, updates, progress, and blockers.
Problem Solving: Assess issues from different vantage points and formulate the best solution to address specific challenges.
Self-Motivation: Exude highest level of commitment and motivation to see it through from start to finish.
Teamwork and Team Building: Establish a collaborative culture where people with unique personalities and skills happily work together and are accountable to the shared goal.
Strong Business Communication: Use the right language, tone and storytelling techniques when communicating, describing, or explaining issues over email, chat, reports, presentations and other forms and channels of communication.

Where You'll Be

Otto Aviation is currently a remote workplace culture, with plans to secure a permanent headquarters for our corporate office in the next 2-3 years.

Benefits

Otto Aviation provides a robust benefits package that includes competitive salaries, subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage, 401(k) opportunities, paid short term disability, voluntary long-term disability and additional term life, with 15 paid days off, 15 paid holidays, and paid sick leave. Depending on seniority and role, some roles qualify for potential bonuses and stock options.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
About the job
Join Our Growing Team Powering a Sustainable, Well, and Resilient Future.

Does this describe you?

Do you like to be a leader in technical design?
Do you like to drive innovation?
Do you like to collaborate with colleagues to solve problems and drive success?
Do you like to continuously learn?
Do you like to build strong client relationships?

If so, now is the perfect time to join HEAPY — a growing firm driven by innovation, purpose, and people. We’re expanding to meet the needs of our clients and communities, creating exciting new roles and growth opportunities along the way.

At HEAPY, our Colleague First approach means we invest in your career, well-being, and success. We’re committed to building a more sustainable world through thoughtful design and collaborative partnerships, and we’re looking for team members who want to grow with us while making an impact.

HEAPY is seeking a Senior Level Mechanical Engineer to join our Colleague First culture in a remote arrangement, but physically within 100 miles of the Greenville, South Carolina area. You’ll be empowered to do meaningful work, develop lasting relationships, and be part of a team where your ideas, growth, and authentic self are truly valued.

Click here to learn more about HEAPY!

Summary

This colleague independently performs a variety of assignments involving the application of standard mechanical design engineering techniques for a medium project or significant segments of a larger project. The incumbent must be capable of exercising independent judgment in evaluating, selecting, and applying standard design engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria to make minor design adaptations and modifications. Provides leadership for 2 to 3 Design Engineer / Designer I & II Colleagues in terms of both Technical Career Development as well as Project Specific direction and oversight.

Qualifications

This position normally requires a 4-year engineering degree from an ABET-accredited program and typically 10+ years of related experience (or equivalent working knowledge/experience/advanced degree in engineering) related to mechanical engineering systems in the Built Environment. This includes considerable experience in utilizing various computer software packages and automated mechanical engineering and design equipment. An incumbent in this position should be in possession of a Professional Engineering (PE) Registration and provides direct oversight and responsible charge over projects for which they are involved.

Duties & Responsibilities

Maintains clear knowledge of HEAPY Corporate Vision, Mission, and Core Values and demonstrates awareness of how those objectives relate to all position responsibilities.
Approaches all assigned tasks as an opportunity for growth and experience, modeling the way for other team members.
Continually advances technical education and personal development aligned with goals, leveraging senior leadership expertise to guide and support colleagues and mentees in achieving their development objectives.
Provides leadership to two or more Design Engineers / Designer I & II colleagues on their technical development and professional growth, supporting the OKR process and providing guidance and mentorship on both technical development and project responsibilities.
Responsible for the design engineering services following with Corporate Vision, Mission, and Core Values as well as Corporate ISO Systems View(s), and related professional standards, client requirements, and corporate objectives.
Collaborates with more experienced Engineering Colleagues to prepare basic plan details and outlines, cost estimates, and perform calculations in support of broader engineering activities involving the design of mechanical equipment, components, or systems.
Collaborates with the Operations Manager, Technical Leader(s), and Project Manager(s) on Project Staffing requirements and Resource Allocation.
Lays out full plan designs, plan details and outlines, identifies quantities of materials, cost estimates, and performs calculations for a detailed segment of a project.
Prepares technical specifications for review and approval.
Evaluates vendors’ bids and drawings to ensure compliance with specifications.
Reviews and approves mechanical design drawings for assigned segments of project.

About the job
The Company:

iON Technology Solutions (iTS) is a privately-owned engineering company and a member firm of Island Group Enterprises (IGE). The Company provides proprietarily engineered designs to Semiconductor Fabrication Plants globally with a focus on the Ion Implantation process. We provide components and design solutions to some of the most complex problems that plague the Semiconductor Wafer Fabrication industry. Our patented Plasmon, Magnon, and Lepton product lines include advanced state of the art Ion Optical Beamline Solutions including but not limited to Ion Implant Sources, Extraction Electrodes, Faraday’s, PEF’s, EMER’s, etc. iTS serves many leading Semiconductor Fabs around the world with our design improvements that significantly reduce their operating expenses. The Company is ISO 9001:2015 certified, maintains a Class 10,000 cleanroom facility, and a complete R&D Metrology and QC lab.

The Position:

The Mechanical Design Engineer will first learn about iTS’s extensive product lines and become familiar with our improved designs for the various Ion Implant tools that iTS supports. The Candidate will work alongside Senior Managers to create, design and test new products for our customers that maximize Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) and Mean Time Between Maintenance (MTBM). Additionally, the Mechanical Design Engineer will work directly with iTS’s engineering and sales team to conceptualize customer requirements and needs that meet and or ideally exceed their expectations.

Responsibilities:
Support Senior Management in the development of new products and the expansion of iTS product lines
Understand the different Ion Implant systems that iTS supports and facilitate new design and development of products and solutions
Create BOMs for new design assemblies
Design experiments to test prototypes
Prepare technical designs, drawings and models of new components and assemblies.
Test prototypes for form, fit and function as well as perform thermal testing analysis
Internalize customer requirements effectively and communicate them to the Engineering and Sales team
Leverage experience to further develop iTS’s Research and Development team
Prioritize and manage customer engineering requests
Assist and lead new R&D projects with the Engineering team

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s in Mechanical Engineering field required;
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a design engineering role; Experience in the Semiconductor and or Ion Optical industry is preferred
Knowledge of Ion Optics and/or Metallurgy of Refractory Metals is preferred
Ability to create and read mechanical drawings and to understand complex Geometric Dimensions & Tolerances as it pertains to Thermodynamics is required
Proficient with CAD software such as Solid Works or Inventor
Proficient with LabVIEW and/or COMSOL is preferred
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in teams
Ability to thrive in a detail-orientated environment
Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook

description:
About the job
Company Overview

Throughout our worldwide network of experts, clients and communities, we are renowned for our leadership in fire protection engineering – a legacy of responsibility we have proudly upheld since 1939. Today, our expertise extends broadly across closely related security and risk-based fields – from accessibility consulting and risk analysis to process safety, forensic investigations, security risk consulting, emergency management, digital innovation and more.

Our engineers and consultants collaborate to solve complex safety and security challenges, ensuring our clients can protect what matters most. For over 80 years, we have helped mitigate risks that threaten lives, property and reputations. Through technology, expertise and industry-leading research, we remain dedicated to our purpose of making our world safe, secure and resilient.

At Jensen Hughes, we believe that creating and sustaining a culture of trust, integrity and professional growth starts with putting our people first. Our employees are our greatest strength, and we value the unique perspectives and talents they bring to our organization.

Our wide range of Global Employee Networks connect people from across the organization, supporting career development and providing forums for individuals to share experiences on topics they're passionate about. Together, we are cultivating a connected culture where everyone has the opportunity to learn, grow and succeed together.

Job Overview

We are seeking detail-oriented and highly analytical Senior Forensic Engineers with expertise in Mechanical, Structural, Fire Protection, Biomechanical and Electrical Engineering to join our team across any of our office locations throughout the United States. Remote and hybrid work options are available. The role involves investigating failures, accidents, and incidents to determine their causes and provide technical analysis to assist in legal, insurance, owner-operator or safety-related matters. The ideal candidate will have an established client network as well as the capability to combine engineering knowledge with investigative skills to analyze complex issues and deliver accurate, well-documented findings.

Some Of What We Offer

Competitive base pay with benefits. We also offer incentive pay options.
Our business development team is dedicated to forensic and fire investigation and provides support by connecting you with clients who are looking to hire expert engineering professionals. 
Our worldwide footprint provides opportunities across the globe.
We have personnel to perform fire modeling.
We have a dust explosion lab in Halifax, Canada.
We have a full metallurgical laboratory with an SEM/EDS that can analyze any metal found in a fire.
We have a plastics and materials testing laboratory that can identify plastic materials involved in a fire and can determine many of the physical properties of these plastics,
We have a full forensics chemistry laboratory that performs analysis of fire debris for ignitable liquids and liquids capable of spontaneous combustion. Laboratory technicians are available to provide direct support to the fire investigator in the best methods to collect forensic samples.
We have voting and alternate members on NFPA 921 Guide for Fire and Explosion Investigations and NFPA 1033 Qualifications for Fire Investigators.
Our experienced in-house legal team can help with trial and deposition preparation.
Our dedicated evidence collection and handling teams will support you to assure that the collection of evidence is properly gathered, retained and tracked from the field.

Responsibilities

Conduct detailed investigations of equipment failures, structural collapses, electrical faults, or other technical issues.
Analyze physical evidence, engineering designs, construction materials, and processes to identify root causes.
Evaluate compliance with engineering standards, building codes, and safety regulations.
Gather and document relevant data from accident scenes, including photographs, measurements, and witness interviews.
Review technical drawings, specifications, and maintenance records to support analyses.
Perform failure analysis and materials testing using appropriate tools and techniques.
Utilize software and models to simulate scenarios leading to failures or accidents.
Prepare detailed, accurate, and objective technical reports outlining findings, conclusions, and recommendations.
Provide expert opinions in layman’s terms for non-technical audiences such as attorneys, insurance adjusters, and juries.
Serve as an expert witness in legal proceedings when required.
Provide clear and concise testimony based on thorough analyses.
Work closely with legal teams, insurance professionals, and other engineers.

Requirements And Qualifications

Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Mechanical, Fire, Civil/Structural, or Electrical Engineering or a related field.
Advanced certifications in forensic engineering are a plus (e.g., CFEI, PE, or equivalent).
15+ years of professional experience in engineering, with a focus on problem-solving, design, and failure analysis.
Prior forensic engineering or accident investigation experience at an engineering consulting firm is required.
Ability to have a transferable book of business.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
High attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects possibly with multiple engineering disciplines while meeting deadlines under pressure.
Ability to work in diverse environments, including construction sites and accident scenes.
Experience testifying in court or providing litigation support is preferred.
Willing to travel up to 30% (+/-) throughout the United States or Canada, often at a moment’s notice.

Please note that the salary range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting and not a guarantee of compensation. Final compensation may vary based on factors, including but not limited to, responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, geographic location, internal equity, alignment with market data.

Jensen Hughes offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401(k) with company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the positions.”

National Pay Range

$127,000—$197,000 USD

The security of your personal data is important to us. Jensen Hughes has implemented reasonable physical, technical, and administrative security standards to protect personal data from loss, misuse, alteration, or destruction. We protect your personal data against unauthorized access, use, or disclosure, using security technologies and procedures, such as encryption and limited access. Only authorized individuals may access your personal data for the purpose for which it was collected, and these individuals receive training about the importance of protecting personal data. Jensen Hughes is committed to compliance with all relevant data privacy laws in all areas where we do business, including, but not limited to, the GDPR and the CCPA. Additionally, our service providers are contractually bound to maintain the confidentiality of personal data and may not use the information for any unauthorized purpose.

Policy on use of 3rd party recruiting agency for direct placements

Jensen Hughes will occasionally augment a recruiting search through agencies for certain positions when business conditions warrant. Jensen Hughes will not accept resumes, inquiries or proposals from recruiting agencies as an acceptable method to consider a candidate. 3rd party recruiting agencies must sign a standard Jensen Hughes agreement after being evaluated and accepted by a Human Resources or Talent Acquisition manager, or member of the talent acquisition team. Hiring managers and employees of Jensen Hughes are not authorized to accept resumes, engage in fee-based searches through recruiting firms or sign a search agreement. title: Component Stress Analysis Engineer
description:
About the job
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and resourceful Core Component Stress Analysis Engineer. In this role, you will perform analyses for structures in a high temperature and high neutron fluence environment to support design solutions for the preliminary and detailed design development of various Reactor Core Components (RCC) and Core Support Systems (CSS) for the Natrium Generation IV Reactor. 

Candidates must have extensive experience in structural analysis and finite element analysis (FEA). The Core Component Stress Analysis Engineer will report to the Core Component Design Manager and join the Mechanical Design Discipline. The Core Component Stress Analysis Engineer will work as part of a high-functioning team of engineers and scientists focused on developing the design of next-generation advanced nuclear reactors.

Responsibilities:
Perform stress analysis for Natrium Core Assemblies using FEA and hand calculations.
Present analysis results to internal and external stakeholders.
Interface with the Core Component Design team’s engineering design activities.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary Engineering and Project Teams on requirements and inputs.
Support continuous learning and application of nuclear industry best practices to maintain the highest quality of engineering design, and proactively identify process change/enhancement opportunities.

Key Qualifications:
Education: B.S. degree in Mechanical engineering or equivalent preferred.
Minimum of ten years of structural analysis experience; relevant M.S. and Doctorate degrees may be credited for up to two and four years of experience, respectively.
Experience in using FEA to perform nonlinear analyses with emphasis on ANSYS or ABAQUS.
Experience with first-principles calculations and use of references for closed form approximations (Shigley’s, Roark’s, etc.).
Experience in scripting languages such as APDL or Python.
Familiarity with standalone CAD packages, SolidWorks preferred.
Working experience with design codes such as the ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code (BPVC) Section III, Division I, Section III, Division V, Section VIII, Division II, and API 579-1/ASME FFS-1.
Excellent writing and communication skills.
The successful candidate will possess a high degree of trust and integrity, communicate openly and display respect, and a desire to foster teamwork.
Strong analytical/problem-solving skills, creative thinker.
Ability to work with minimum direction to solve challenging problems.

About the job
Henderson Engineers is seeking a Lead CFD Modeler to join their Strategic Consulting Team. The Lead CFD Modeler provides technical leadership and oversight for a team of CFD modelers, ensuring alignment on best practices, engineering standards, and growth opportunities. They are responsible for managing CFD modeling projects, including budgets, schedules, and deliverables while collaborating with engineering, operations, and management teams. The Lead CFD Modeler also works closely with construction teams to integrate CFD modeling into project designs, ensuring high-quality, cost-effective solutions.

Minimum Qualifications for the Role are:
Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a related field required. 4 years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
Minimum 7 years of experience in CFD modeling and mechanical design required.
Experience in data center and mission-critical projects required.
Proven ability to lead technical design teams and collaborate across disciplines.
Background in designing various facility types, including healthcare, research labs, and large venues.
Proficiency in CFD software such as ANSYS Fluent, StarCCM+, FloEFD, and FDS.
In-depth understanding of thermodynamics, heat transfer, and fluid dynamics.
Familiarity with design tools like AutoCAD, Revit, BIM, and Navisworks.
Effective communication and analytical skills with a commitment to quality and attention to detail.
Knowledge of scripting and automation using Python, C++, or Java.
Must demonstrate proficiency in all core competencies as described and characterized in this job description.

Preferred Qualifications & Plusses:
Professional Engineer (P.E.) license preferred.

Skills and Duties you will be Responsible for while in this role:
Leadership & Team Development:
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to the CFD modeling team.
Develop team goals, establish expectations, and identify growth opportunities for staff.
Lead team meetings and resource planning to ensure effective allocation of resources.
Foster a culture of continuous learning by creating training content and enhancing technical skills.

CFD Modeling Projects:

Assists construction managers in the planning, design, and construction of a project.
Informs project team of complexity, critical path items and other considerations in establishing the budget and schedule for projects.
Analyzes problems and develops resolutions.
Develops appropriate documentation to coordinate the construction process.

Technical Assistance & Mentoring:

Manage CFD modeling projects, ensuring alignment with client objectives, timelines, and budgets.
Perform advanced airflow CFD modeling, including simulations for interior and exterior spaces, with a focus on data centers.
Conduct model runs, sensitivity analyses, and quantitative evaluations to optimize designs.
Ensure calibration of models to reflect real-world conditions post-construction and commissioning.

Standards & Innovation:

Develop and maintain technical CFD modeling standards, templates, and procedures.
Collaborate with sector engineering and construction teams to ensure seamless integration of modeling standards.
Stay current with industry trends and innovations to enhance team capabilities and project outcomes.

Client & Stakeholder Engagement:

Function as the primary point of contact for CFD modeling services, delegating tasks and opportunities effectively.
Prepare and present detailed modeling reports to clients and stakeholders using clear technical narratives, visualizations, and graphics.
Maintain strong relationships with internal and external partners to support and expand business opportunities.

Technical Expertise:

Evaluate and recommend CFD modeling software and tools for quality and efficiency.
Perform design optimization, assess system capacities, and evaluate solutions for new construction or system upgrades.
Ensure compliance with building codes and ordinances, including ASHRAE standards.
Use scripting and automation (e.g., Python, C++) to enhance modeling workflows and accuracy.

description:
About the job
Meta is seeking a Mechanical Engineer experienced in the design and construction of Critical Facilities to become part of our Data Center Design team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our software operates. Building and operating reliable and efficient data centers is essential to support the growth of Meta. The data center design team collaborates with all key stakeholders to ensure engineering and design of our data centers incorporate considerations from micro-levels (servers and IT equipment design requirements) to macro-levels (mechanical cooling and power distribution options) to enable maximum efficiency and reliability of our compute infrastructure. As an integral part of the Design team, you will support design and construction administration as Design Owner Representative, Mechanical Design Engineer and subject matter expert, collaborating with multiple internal partner teams such as Engineering, Construction Management, Quality, Safety, and Facility Engineering, and external partners such as engineers of record, general contractors, and regulatory agencies to deliver data center capacity safely, on time, within budget, and of high quality. This position is full-time, based in one of our US-office locations within the DEC (Design, Engineering and Construction) Team.

Mechanical Engineer, Data Center Design Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Design and Delivery teams, engineer of record (EoR), contractors, and regulatory agencies to resolve issues involving safety, quality, cost, schedule, proposed changes, value engineering proposals, submittal reviews, requests for information and other design related issues.
Collaborate with the Meta Design team and EoR to ensure design deliverables such as drawing sets, shop drawings, requests for information, submittals, studies, audits, calculations and reports meet requirements and service level agreements outlined in EoR performance requirements.
Drive and hold teams accountable for design deliverables and engage on emerging requirements to ensure schedule milestones are met. Advise on opportunities to compress schedules wherever possible.
Proactively anticipate and mitigate potential design quality issues. Monitor and resolve design quality issues to ensure owner requirements are met.
Support design change cost estimates, provide insight on EoR contractual costs, team resource allocations and changes, monitor and report on mechanical-related expenses.
In collaboration with stakeholders, engage in deliberate, forward thinking to identify and mitigate risks. Contribute to the risk register.
Participate in factory tests, onsite testing and commissioning and other quality checks throughout the project life cycle and in partnership with cross-functional teams to ensure proper installation and commissioning of mechanical systems and integration with other critical systems.
Liaise between internal teams, consultants and contractors across projects and campus to ensure transparency, situational awareness of status and way forward, and timely resolution of issues.
Maintain current awareness of project knowledge repository, status, decision, and planning documents. Maintain accurate records and documentation. Provide regular project updates to internal stakeholders and information sharing, priorities, and feedback to EoR.
Review and comment on mechanical design documents, specifications, and calculations.
Provide technical expertise and oversight to ensure the design and construction meet the owner's requirements and industry standards for critical facility mechanical systems including Manufactured/Owner Furnished Equipment (M/OFE).
Collaborate with other technical disciplines as required to ensure fully functioning, integrated systems. Actively guide Cross-Discipline technical interactions within Meta Design team and EOR to ensure multi-disciplinary team alignment.
Develop and support onboarding of new teammates to ensure continuity of design support.
Develop cross discipline knowledge to ensure continuity and build breadth and depth of the overall field design team.
Provide deliberate and thoughtful development and embedment of lessons learned for design improvements of inflight and future products.
Manage multi-disciplinary work, occasionally non-mechanical related, as needed to support the project and Meta business objectives.
Collaborate and support in innovating Design-Construction technology and processes
Close collaboration and engagement with the Quality Team, with focus on area walk downs, critical benchmarks, systems integration and operation, issue resolution, TAB, Commissioning Script review and implementation, providing technical support and guidance on Design related matters.
Support Facilities Engineering and Operations Team on knowledge sharing, technical guidance and system operation of Design throughout the project schedule.

Minimum Qualifications:

BS in Mechanical Engineering.
Licensed Professional Engineer.
10+ years of professional experience in mission critical building design, construction, and/or operations.
Knowledge depth (SME) of HVAC systems including Evaporative Systems, Chilled/Condenser Water/Liquid Cooled Systems, Air Handling Systems Hot/Cold aisle containment, data center rack/row level liquid cooling designs/technologies, and Building Management System/Controls Automation.
Knowledge of Plumbing systems including Water Treatment, Pumping Systems and Distribution, Sanitary/Waste Systems, and Storm Drainage Systems.
Knowledge of Fire Protection/Fire Alarm systems such as Early Warning/Detection Systems, Double Interlock Pre-Action, and Wet Pipe Systems.
Knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards including UMC, NFPA, ASHRAE, UBC, UMC and LEED.
Proven analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Project Management Experience.
Effective presentation and communication skills to peers.
Fluent in English.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience on liquid cooling mission critical facilities.
Experience with Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC), Revit, Visio, Bluebeam software, Oracle P6, Google suite, FLOTHERM or AFT Fathom.
Experience with construction and cost estimating processes.
Experience with local/state code compliance.

description:
About the job
At ITT, we have a clear purpose as an organization – to provide our customers with cutting-edge solutions to help solve their most critical needs across key global end markets. Our continuous improvement mindset drives our commitment to evolving our capabilities as a multi-industrial technology, manufacturing and engineering leader. With a strong global footprint of more than 100 facilities, we are well positioned to solve critical challenges for our customers around the world. Our locations include manufacturing facilities and global service capabilities in 35 countries. Through these worldwide operations and building on our heritage of innovation, our approximately ~11,000 team members partner with our customers to deliver enduring solutions that make a lasting difference and help the world move forward. ITT is headquartered in Stamford, CT, with sales in approximately 125 countries. The company generated 2024 revenues of $3.6 billion.

 Motion Technologies: (Revenue of $1.4B; headcount of ~ 4,000; operates in 13 countries) manufactures brake components and specialized sealing solutions, shock absorbers and damping technologies primarily for the global automotive, truck and trailer, public bus and rail transportation markets. 
 Industrial Process: (Revenue of $1.4B; headcount of ~3,400; operates in 30 countries) manufactures engineered fluid process equipment serving a diversified mix of customers in global industries such as chemical, energy, mining, and other industrial process markets and is a provider of plant optimization and efficiency solutions and aftermarket services and parts. 
 Connect and Control Technologies: (Revenue of $0.8B; headcount of ~ 3,800; operates in 10 countries) manufactures harsh-environment connector solutions, critical energy absorption, flow control components, and composite materials for the aerospace and defense, general industrial, medical, and energy markets. 

Position Summary

We are looking for an experienced CFD engineer to join our team focusing on the research and development of rotodynamic pumps. In this role you will utilize advanced CFD analysis to predict pump performance and study complex fluid phenomena. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to enhance product performance, solve complex fluid flow challenges, and drive innovation in pump design.

 Support the development of new hydraulic for customer orders ($20K to $500K per project) 
 Support the development of new hydraulic for new products ($0.5M to $20M annual sales) 

Essential Responsibilities

 Execute advanced CFD analysis of rotodynamic pumps for new product, technology or live order projects 
 Execute CFD correlation studies and maintain metrics 
 Define and maintain department standards for CFD analysis 
 Research new CFD analysis applications for rotodynamic pumps 

Position Requirements

Education: Mechanical Engineering Degree or related field, Ph. D preferred
Experience: 7 years of professional and/or graduate experience in CFD analysis with a strong focus on turbomachinery, rotodynamic pumps and hydro turbines preferred
Strong understanding of fluid mechanics and CFD principles
Experience in commercial CFD software packages, ANSYS CFX preferred
Proficiency generating high quality CFD meshes
Strong understanding of CFD solvers
Experience correlating CFD analysis to experimental data

#IP1

 Equal Pay Act Statement 

We aim to pay our ‘ITT’ers’ fairly and competitively in the locations that they live and work. Pay-for-performance is a principle that we believe in, and employees are rewarded based not only on ‘what’ they accomplish, but also on ‘how’ they reflect ITT’s values. ITT offers a competitive salary and robust total rewards package, such as health insurance, 401(k), short and long-term disability, paid time off, growth and developmental opportunities, and other incentive compensation programs. Specific benefits are dependent upon whether or not the position is part of a collective-bargaining agreement. The salary offered to a candidate is based several factors such as candidate experience and qualifications, location, as well as market and business considerations.

 Equal Pay Act Range 

Annual Salary Range $97,800 to $146,200 Plus Benefits and Incentive Plans.

description:
About the job
Mechanical Engineer – Material Handling Systems & Custom Conveyor Design

MUST BE LOCATED IN EST or CST - Willing to Travel up to 20%. Work from home otherwise

6-9 month contract to start. No 3rd party/C2C shops please!

We are seeking an experienced and driven Mechanical Engineer with a strong background in the material handling industry, particularly in distribution center operations and the design of custom industrial equipment such as spiral conveyors, modular conveyor systems, and automated handling equipment.
This is a hands-on engineering role focused on designing and improving high-performance, configurable material handling systems for warehouse and industrial environments. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, project-driven setting and has a proven track record in developing mechanical solutions tailored to customer specifications.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design and engineering of custom conveyor systems and industrial material handling equipment from concept through production release.
Collaborate closely with sales and customer teams to engineer solutions for custom orders and unique operational requirements in distribution and fulfillment centers.
Develop and maintain detailed mechanical drawing packages for fabrication and field installation using 3D CAD (Inventor, AutoCAD) and Autodesk Vault.
Specify and source mechanical components, custom fabrications, and vendor-supplied items suited to heavy industrial and high-throughput environments.
Oversee engineering configuration management, ensuring accurate BOMs and CAD models are synced with the ERP system.
Participate in design reviews, project updates, and cross-functional engineering meetings.
Conduct on-site visits to manufacturing facilities and customer locations to support equipment commissioning, field evaluations, and future system planning.
Ensure compliance with ANSI, ASME, and relevant safety and mechanical design standards.
Qualifications:
B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent field.
7+ years of experience in mechanical design, ideally focused on conveyor systems, automation, or intralogistics equipment.
Proven experience with material handling systems in industrial or warehouse distribution center environments.
Strong working knowledge of Inventor, AutoCAD, MS Office, and Autodesk Vault.
Expertise in analyzing mechanical challenges from multiple angles and developing innovative, practical solutions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially when engaging cross-functional teams or clients.
Willingness to travel (10–20%) to customer sites or internal build locations.
Preferred Experience:
In-depth knowledge of custom conveyor solutions, automated systems, spiral conveyors, and modular material handling technologies.
Experience in the automation, intralogistics, or distribution sectors.
Exposure to lean manufacturing, fabrication techniques, or rapid prototyping.

description:
About the job
Edged has an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about sustainability and eager to be part of an innovative company that’s on a journey to transform the world’s data center infrastructure. We are seeking a Mechanical Systems Design Engineer to work directly with the Edged Energy team and focus on deploying our cutting-edge ThermalWorks cooling solutions into the latest data center deployments. This role will focus on the development and optimization of integrated mechanical systems — including liquid and air cooling, containment systems, and support infrastructure — while collaborating closely with internal engineering and product teams as well as external clients. The ideal candidate combines deep technical expertise with strong communication skills and has a proven background in both data center cooling infrastructure and design engineering/coordination.

Edged is highly selective about the people we bring on board because our mission depends on it. Progress happens quickly and we must be able to trust one another to be transparent, communicative, strategic, reliable, and driven. We seek ultra-creatives and superstar performers with a sense of humility and a hunger to make a positive impact in the world. We offer flexibility and endless growth opportunities to those who can harness their skills and talents and identify how and where to use them to add value.

Key Responsibilities

Include but are not limited to:

Work alongside internal product teams in design and development of mechanical systems for data center infrastructure deployments, from concept through delivery.
Own the technical design process, including system architecture, component selection, layout, and integration across disciplines.
Utilize Revit and other digital design tools for creating accurate models, drawings, and system documentation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including electrical, structural, and mechanical product engineers to ensure fully integrated designs.
Engage with product managers and sales teams to define customer requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Provide sales engineering support for internal and external stakeholders, including product presentations, technical responses, and proposal input.
Participate in client-facing technical discussions, design reviews, and design-build proposal development.
Work with product engineers to develop and implement the next generation of cooling equipment.
Oversee testing, prototyping, and validation of mechanical systems in collaboration with manufacturing and R&D.
Identify opportunities for product innovation and cost optimization through materials, processes, and system improvements.
Ensure designs comply with relevant standards and customer specifications.

Skills & Requirements

Education / Experience
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related technical discipline.
Minimum 7+ years of experience in mechanical design or construction, preferably in the data center or mission-critical infrastructure space.
Demonstrated experience with Revit and/or other digital design tools is preferred.
Experience in product lifecycle management, from concept through manufacturing release is a plus.
Prior experience in customer-facing technical roles is highly desirable particularly in the hyperscale data center market.

Specific Skills / Abilities
Strong understanding of thermal management, airflow, and cooling system design.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Experience working with modular systems or prefabricated mechanical systems is preferred.

Great Place to Work
Enjoy…
A fast-paced, entrepreneurial culture focused on innovation.
A flexible, autonomous work environment.
A culture of respect, learning, and excellence.
Experienced, highly talented experts as team peers.
Growth and travel opportunities.
A team of change-makers having a significant impact on people and the planet.

Edged is a fast-growing global network of carbon neutral, zero-water data centers that lead the industry in energy efficiency. The Edged platform is backed by a deep technology stack including advanced waterless cooling, renewable microgrid systems, ultra-clean generators and waste-to-fuel solutions. The platform is designed for rapid deployment and currently has more than a dozen major projects in construction worldwide, with many more in development.

Full-Time or Part-Time: Full-Time
Reports to: Senior Design Manager
Location: United States (Remote)

Knauf Insulation North America is the world's fastest-growing insulation manufacturer. We are wholly committed to the conservation of the environment while also sustainably developing and manufacturing a comprehensive line of acoustical fiberglass insulation for residential, commercial, industrial, marine, OEM and metal building applications, using post-consumer recycled materials.

We welcome passionate and creative individuals who thrive in an entrepreneurial, collaborative and ever-changing environment. Watch our values video to learn more about what we do, our commitment to sustainability and our company values and culture.

We know how important your health, wellbeing, and financial strength is to you. To support you, we provide affordable benefits for you and your family members.

"Supporting all aspects of the individual — self, health, wealth and community”

Our benefits include:

 Medical, Dental, Vision – starting on day one! 
 Virtual Medical Services 
 401(k) Retirement Plan (earn 100% matching on your first 6% and fully vested day one) 
 Paid parental leave 
 Company paid life insurance 
 Vacation time to enjoy getting away 
 Tuition Reimbursement 
 Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
 Plus, more! 

Growth opportunities available!

Apply online or contact us to hear why our employees appreciate being part of the Knauf family!

Summary of Position: 

Knauf Insulation is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Special Projects Engineer to provide mechanical engineering support for maintenance and capital projects across our North American footprint. This role will focus on improving fiberglass manufacturing processes, managing capital projects, and driving innovation in equipment design and process optimization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in mechanical engineering, project management, and industrial manufacturing, with a passion for continuous improvement and collaboration.

If you are a proactive and innovative engineer with a passion for driving improvements in manufacturing processes, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join Knauf Insulation!

 Must be willing to relocate to one of our U.S. locations to be considered for the role (Relocation is provided): 

 Albion, MI
 Lanett, AL
 Inwood, WV
 McGregor, TX
 Shasta Lake, CA
 Shelbyville, IN

Responsibilities

 Provide mechanical engineering expertise for maintenance and capital projects. 
 Guide staff engineers and designers at both corporate and plant levels to improve fiberglass manufacturing processes. 
 Design and/or redesign mechanical equipment for insulation manufacturing. 
 Manage contractors and engineers for the design, installation, and startup of equipment. 
 Develop improved processes to enhance quality, reduce scrap, and optimize raw material utilization. 
 Assist in the startup and debugging of new production facilities.

title: Simulation Engineer - Electromagnetic Specialist
description:
About the job
PhysicsX is a deep-tech company with roots in numerical physics and Formula One, dedicated to accelerating hardware innovation at the speed of software.

We are building an AI-driven simulation software stack for engineering and manufacturing across advanced industries. By enabling high-fidelity, multi-physics simulation through AI inference across the entire engineering lifecycle, PhysicsX unlocks new levels of optimization and automation in design, manufacturing, and operations — empowering engineers to push the boundaries of possibility. Our customers include leading innovators in Aerospace & Defense, Materials, Energy, Semiconductors, and Automotive.

We are about to take the next leap in building out our technology platform and product offering. In this context, we are looking for a capable and enthusiastic simulation engineer to join our team. If all of this sounds exciting to you, we would love to talk (even if you don't tick all the boxes).

Note: We do not provide visa sponsorship in the US. Please only apply if you have the right to work in the US.

Position Overview

We are seeking a skilled Electromagnetic Simulation Expert with a strong focus on high-frequency electromagnets applications such as radio antenna design, induction heating processes, wireless charging systems. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of electromagnetics, particularly Maxwell's equations, and the underlying physical mechanisms. Working with us offers a unique opportunity to help shape how AI is transforming the simulation landscape and be at the front of a changing industry.

Join us in New York! This is a hybrid role, meaning you'll enjoy the best of both worlds- flexibility and in-person collaboration. We work together in our NYC office to foster innovation, teamwork and problem-solving. If you're in (or ready to move to) New York and want to be part of a dynamic, hands-on environment, we'd love to hear from you!

What You Will Do

Work closely with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and clients to develop an understanding of the physics and engineering challenges being solved
Set up and build multi-physics models to simulate and understand complex real-world phenomena
Automate simulation pipelines to enable fast optimization and parametric CAD coupling
Use on-premise HPC and cloud resources to accelerate high-fidelity models beyond smart model setup and meshing choices
Own the delivery of technical work streams, potentially mentoring more junior colleagues
Work at the intersection of CAE and data science, generating highly accurate results and predictions in conjunction with advanced machine learning and deep learning models
Continuously apply and improve engineering best practices and standards, coaching colleagues in their adoption


What You Bring To The Table

Electromagnetic Modelling: Develop and analyse electromagnetic models, focusing on real-world applications such as antenna design, induction heating processes, wireless charging, electric motor technologies, and electronic shielding
Create multi-physics simulations for electromagnetic, flow, thermal, and mechanical analyses to evaluate comprehensive system performance
Possesses advanced knowledge in high-frequency and low-frequency electromagnetic simulation software (3-6 years), such as Ansys HFSS, Ansys Maxwell, COMSOL, Altair’s FEKO, Dassault CST, or other EM Simulation Tools
Performance Optimization: Identify and implement improvements based on simulation results to enhance system performance
Demonstrate the ability to scope and effectively deliver projects
Exhibit strong problem-solving abilities to analyse issues, identify causes, and recommend solutions quickly
Collaboration and Communication: Possess excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with teams and customers
For more experienced candidates, have a passion for and a track record of managing, mentoring, and coaching junior colleagues
Ideally, possess advanced Python and Java coding skills


What We Offer

Be part of something larger: Make an impact and meaningfully shape an early-stage company. Work on some of the most exciting and important topics there are. Do something you can be proud of!
Work with a fun group of colleagues that support you, challenge you and help you grow. We come from many different backgrounds, but what we have in common is the desire to operate at the very top of our fields and solve truly challenging problems in science and engineering. If you are similarly capable, caring and driven, you'll find yourself at home here
Experience a truly flat hierarchy. Voicing your ideas is not only welcome but encouraged, especially when they challenge the status quo
Work sustainably, striking the right balance between work and personal life
Receive a competitive compensation and equity package, in addition to plenty of perks


We value diversity and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion, ethnicity, nationality, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply. To help make a change, we sponsor bright women from disadvantaged backgrounds through their university degrees in science and mathematics.

description:
About the job
DSJ Global is currently partnering with a global materials manufacturing company to identify a candidate for a Senior Regional Mechanical Engineer to serve as a subject matter expert for Piping Design across multiple sites. This individual will be responsible for leading the design, analysis, and execution of complex piping systems across diverse projects. You'll ensure all solutions meet the highest standards of quality, safety, and performance, while mentoring junior engineers and working closely with clients, project managers, and cross-functional teams.
This is a remote opportunity with up to 40% travel to manufacturing sites but the ideal candidate will be based on the east coast.

Job Responsibilities: 
Lead the design and development of complex piping systems, ensuring full compliance with industry standards and codes such as ASME, ANSI, and API.
Create and review piping layouts, isometric drawings, and 3D models using tools like AutoCAD, Revit, and other specialized design software.
Perform detailed engineering analyses, including piping stress calculations, material selection, and safety evaluations to ensure system integrity and reliability.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams-including structural, electrical, and instrumentation engineers-to ensure seamless integration of piping systems into overall project designs.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior engineers, promoting best practices and maintaining high engineering standards.
Review and approve vendor documentation, specifications, and equipment to support procurement and ensure alignment with project requirements.
Manage project deliverables, ensuring piping design packages are completed on time and within budget.
Conduct site visits, feasibility studies, and commissioning activities to validate design performance and compliance with client and regulatory expectations.
Champion safety, quality, and environmental standards throughout all phases of design and implementation.
Prepare and deliver technical reports, proposals, and presentations for internal stakeholders and clients.
Stay ahead of industry trends, emerging technologies, and materials to continuously enhance design processes and project outcomes.

Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
8+ years of experience in mechanical engineering, with a strong emphasis on piping design.
Deep knowledge of piping design principles, including material selection, stress analysis, and system layout.
Proficiency in CAD and 3D modeling software, such as AutoCAD, Revit, and Plant 3D.
Strong familiarity with industry codes and standards, including ASME B31.3, ASME B31.1, API, and other relevant guidelines.
Proven experience in project management, including leading design teams, coordinating across disciplines, and delivering projects on time and within budget.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Strong communication and leadership abilities, with the confidence to engage effectively with clients, contractors, and internal teams.
Willingness and ability to travel up to 40% to manufacturing and project sites, depending on project needs.

description:
About the job
Job Description:
Review technical submissions for non-water fire extinguishing systems, dry chemical systems, carbon dioxide systems. Review technical plans, reports and engineering calculations prepared by consulting engineers, Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratories and Master Fire Suppression contractors as required by NYC Fire Code section 105.4. Prepare oral and written presentations. Engage in studies or investigations related to proposed fire suppression systems to determine design feasibility and impacts on operational procedures during fire and non-fire related emergencies. Research emerging technologies, determine performance during fire scenarios and consult with management level staff to support policy-making decisions. Review technical calculations related to project submissions. Prepare written approval/disapproval letters for supervisors.

Requested skill set: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or Bachelor’s degree in Fire Protection Engineering. Excellent analytical skills. Excellent communication skills. Team player. 0-3 years of work experience. 
Knowledge of NYC Construction Codes and Fire Code is a plus.
